What would be a half way cool move for black here would be Qa4, which attacks two different undefended pawns (Pe4 & Pa2).  White must choose which one to save.
moves.18... Rae8: This move leaves Pa7 undefended from BxPa7.
moves.19... Qa4: On the other hand, white cannot save both the bishop and Pa2.  Qe3 seems like a good idea.
moves.20. Qe3 Qxa2 21. g4 g5 22. hxg5: Oh no, the white queen shares the same diagonal with the king.  With this blunder black can pin the white queen with BxPg5.
moves.22... Bxg5 23. Qxg5+ hxg5 24. Rh7+: White would probably have been better off moving the bishop.  This challenge can be defended by Rf7 in which case white is compelled to exchange, and down 6 points every trade works to black's mathematical advantage.
moves.24... Rf7 25. Rh5: Trading would have saved white from QxBa7.
moves.25... Qxa7 26. Rxg5: Rh2 or Rf1 here.  (Rd2 just makes Qa1# even quicker).
